recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Sweet Potato Cutlet is an easy and healthier appetizer that can be enjoyed anytime of the day. Sweet potato is rich in Vitamin B6, Vitamin C and D. It also contains iron and is a good source of magnesium and potassium.
Using cheese in this recipe acts as a binding agent makes it more rich in calcium. This recipe is favorite among kids.
The same recipe could be used to make potato cutlets.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash sweet potatoes well,cut it into 2 or 3 pieces and boil it in water until soft. You can also pressure cook for 3 whistles. Once it cools down, remove the skin and mash it well to remove all the lumps.
Keep oil on medium flame for frying. Meanwhile, add all the ingredients to the mashed potato and mix it well to make a dough.

Take a small portion of the mix and flatten it in the form of tikki or cutlet. Cover the tikki throughout with bread crumb and fry it in oil till golden brown. Remove excess oil and keep it aside on tissue paper to remove excess oil. Enjoy with chutney as tea time snack.

tips.tipDesc: For healthier option, you can also roast the tikki or cutlet on a pan or bake it in oven at 180Â° C for 20 mins.
I have used Colby and Mozzarella cheese. You can use any of your favourite cheeses.
If  bread crumbs are unavailable, use Sooji (Semolina).
